intro: Haageocereus chosicensis f. rubrospinus, commonly known as the red-spined hedgehog cactus, is a rare and striking cactus native to Bolivia. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in prominent, red-brown spines, which give it its distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a vibrant touch to its arid habitat. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a challenging but rewarding plant for experienced growers. Due to its limited distribution and conservation status, it is often cultivated in specialized collections.
